intro: Pedicularis omiiana var. typica, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes hemiparasitic plants that derive some of their nutrients from host plants. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, adapted for pollination by insects. It grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in moist, shaded areas. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat.
